'''Faustino Marcos Alberto Rojo''' ({{IPA-es|ˈmaɾkos ˈroxo|}}; born 20 March 1990) is an Argentine [[Association football|footballer]] who plays for [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] and the [[Argentina national football team|Argentina national team]] as a [[Defender (association football)|defender]].
+
'''Faustino Marcos Alberto Rojo''' known simply as '''Marcos Rojo''' ({{IPA-es|ˈmaɾkos ˈroxo|}}; born 20 March 1990) is an [[Argentina|Argentine]] [[Association football|footballer]] who plays for [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] and the [[Argentina national football team|Argentina national team]] as a [[Defender (association football)|defender]].
    −
He began his career at local club [[Estudiantes de La Plata]], where he won the [[Copa Libertadores]] in 2009 and played in the [[2009 FIFA Club World Cup Final|Club World Cup Final]] later that year. After a short spell with [[FC Spartak Moscow|Spartak Moscow]] he joined [[Sporting CP]] in 2012, and transferred to Manchester United for £16 million two years later.
+
He began his career at local club [[Estudiantes de La Plata]], where he won the [[Copa Libertadores]] in 2009 and played in the [[2009 FIFA Club World Cup Final|Club World Cup Final]] later that year. After a short spell with [[FC Spartak Moscow|Spartak Moscow]] he joined [[Sporting CP]] in 2012, and transferred to [[Manchester United F.C|Manchester United]] for £16 million two years later.
     
Rojo made his first appearance for Argentina at senior level in 2011 and has since earned over 25 caps. He was part of their side which reached the [[2014 FIFA World Cup Final]], and was the only Argentine included in the Team of the Tournament.
 
Rojo made his first appearance for Argentina at senior level in 2011 and has since earned over 25 caps. He was part of their side which reached the [[2014 FIFA World Cup Final]], and was the only Argentine included in the Team of the Tournament.

{{Use dmy dates|date=August 2014}} {{Infobox football biography | name = Marcos Rojo | image = Marcos Rojo – Portugal vs. Argentina, 9th February 2011 (1).jpg | image_size = 220 | caption = Rojo playing for [[Argentina national football team|Argentina]] in 2011 | fullname = Faustino Marcos Alberto Rojo{{cite web|title=2014 FIFA World Cup Brazil ™ - List of Players|url=http://resources.fifa.com/mm/document/tournament/competition/02/36/33/44/fwc_2014_squadlists_neutral.pdf|publisher=[[FIFA]]|accessdate=7 July 2014}} | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1990|3|20|df=y}} | birth_place = [[La Plata]], Argentina | height = {{height|m=1.87}} | position = [[Defender (association football)#Centre-back|Centre-back]]
[[Defender (association football)#Full-back|Left-back]] | currentclub = [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] | clubnumber = 5 | youthyears1 = 2000–2008 |youthclubs1 = [[Estudiantes de La Plata|Estudiantes LP]] | years1 = 2008–2011 |clubs1 = [[Estudiantes de La Plata|Estudiantes LP]] |caps1 = 43 |goals1 = 3 | years2 = 2011–2012 |clubs2 = [[FC Spartak Moscow|Spartak Moscow]] |caps2 = 8 |goals2 = 0 | years3 = 2012–2014 |clubs3 = [[Sporting Clube de Portugal|Sporting CP]] |caps3 = 49 |goals3 = 5 | years4 = 2014– |clubs4 = [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] |caps4 = 4 |goals4 = 0 | nationalyears1 = 2011– |nationalteam1 = [[Argentina national football team|Argentina]] |nationalcaps1 = 29 |nationalgoals1 = 1 | medaltemplates = {{Medal|Team|Argentina}} {{MedalCompetition|[[FIFA World Cup]]}} {{Medal|RU|[[2014 FIFA World Cup|2014 Brazil]]|[[Argentina national football team|Team]]}} | club-update = 27 September 2014 | nationalteam-update = 14 September 2014 }} '''Faustino Marcos Alberto Rojo''' known simply as '''Marcos Rojo''' ({{IPA-es|ˈmaɾkos ˈroxo|}}; born 20 March 1990) is an [[Argentina|Argentine]] [[Association football|footballer]] who plays for [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] and the [[Argentina national football team|Argentina national team]] as a [[Defender (association football)|defender]]. He began his career at local club [[Estudiantes de La Plata]], where he won the [[Copa Libertadores]] in 2009 and played in the [[2009 FIFA Club World Cup Final|Club World Cup Final]] later that year. After a short spell with [[FC Spartak Moscow|Spartak Moscow]] he joined [[Sporting CP]] in 2012, and transferred to [[Manchester United F.C|Manchester United]] for £16 million two years later. Rojo made his first appearance for Argentina at senior level in 2011 and has since earned over 25 caps. He was part of their side which reached the [[2014 FIFA World Cup Final]], and was the only Argentine included in the Team of the Tournament. ==Club career== ===Estudiantes LP=== Rojo grew up in [[La Plata]], Argentina and joined his local side [[Estudiantes de La Plata]] at the age of ten.{{cn|date=August 2014}} In 2009, he was promoted to the club’s main team, after signing his first professional contract. He spent three years with the club, making 43 appearances and scoring three goals for the team.http://www.espnfc.com/player/129426/marcos-rojo, Marcos Rojo - Player Profile , [[ESPN FC]] He played in the [[2009 FIFA Club World Cup Final]], coming on for extra time as Estudiantes lost 2–1 to [[FC Barcelona]] in [[Dubai]].{{cite web|title=Estduiantes 1-2 Barcelona|url=http://www.fifa.com/tournaments/archive/clubworldcup/uae2009/matches/round=252913/match=300111971/index.html|publisher=[[FIFA]]|accessdate=30 August 2014}} During his time at Estudiantes, Rojo won a [[Copa Libertadores]] and an [[Argentine Primera Division]] title. The defender spent most matches at [[left back]] and developed a reputation as a capable attacker, scoring his first goal in a 2–1 defeat against [[LDU Quito]] in the [[2010 Recopa Sudamericana]]. ===Spartak Moscow=== [[File:Marcos Rojo 6127.jpg|thumb|left|200px|Rojo playing for [[FC Spartak Moscow|Spartak Moscow]] in March 2011.]] In December 2010, Rojo signed a five-year contract with [[FC Spartak Moscow|Spartak Moscow]].{{cite web|title=Попов: с Рохо в России можно сравнить разве что Луковича|url=http://www.championat.com/football/news-685686.html|website=http://www.championat.com|publisher=Championat|accessdate=12 August 2014|language=Russian|date=19 December 2010}} He scored his only goal for Spartak on 20 April 2011, netting the opening goal of a 2−1 defeat of [[FC Krasnodar|Krasnodar]] in the quarter-finals of the [[2010–11_Russian_Cup#Quarterfinals|Russian Cup]].{{cite web|url=http://us.soccerway.com/matches/2011/04/20/russia/cup/fk-spartak-moskva/fk-krasnodar/1086566/ |title=Spartak Moskva vs. Krasnodar 2-1 |work=Soccerway |date=20 April 2011 |accessdate=4 September 2014 }} ===Sporting Lisbon=== In July 2012, Rojo moved from Spartak Moscow to [[Sporting Lisbon]] for £3.5 million, signing a four-year contract.{{cite web|url=http://www.goal.com/en/news/91/portugal/2012/07/20/3252963/sporting-lisbon-swoop-for-spartak-moscow-defender-marcos |title=Sporting Lisbon swoop for Spartak Moscow defender Marcos Rojo |publisher=Goal |date=20 July 2012 |accessdate=4 September 2014 }} Rojo made his [[2012–13 Primeira Liga|league]] debut for Sporting on 19 August 2012, playing the entire match and receiving a yellow card in a 0−0 draw with [[Vitória S.C.|Vitória]].{{cite web|url=http://us.soccerway.com/matches/2012/08/19/portugal/portuguese-liga-/vitoria-guimaraes/sporting-clube-de-portugal/1316779/ |title=VITÓRIA GUIMARÃES VS. SPORTING CP 0 - 0 |work=Soccerway |date=19 August 2012 |accessdate=4 September 2014 }} He received his first red card for Sporting in a league match against [[FC Porto]] on 7 October 2012, picking up two cautions within three minutes, as Sporting fell to a 2−0 defeat.{{cite web|url=http://us.soccerway.com/matches/2012/10/07/portugal/portuguese-liga-/futebol-clube-do-porto/sporting-clube-de-portugal/1316817/ |title=Porto vs. Sporting CP 2-0 |work=Soccerway |date=7 October 2012 |accessdate=4 September 2014 }} He scored his first goal for Sporting on 28 April 2013, netting the winner against [[C.D. Nacional|Nacional]].{{cite web|url=http://us.soccerway.com/matches/2013/04/28/portugal/portuguese-liga-/sporting-clube-de-portugal/clube-desportivo-nacional/1316982/ |title=Sporting CP vs. CD Nacional 2-1 |work=Soccerway |date=28 April 2013 |accessdate=4 September 2014 }} In the second league match of the [[2013–14 Sporting Clube de Portugal season|2013-14 season]], Rojo scored his first goal of the season, netting Sporting's second goal in their 4−0 win over [[Associação Académica de Coimbra – O.A.F.|Académica]].{{cite web|url=http://us.soccerway.com/matches/2013/08/24/portugal/portuguese-liga-/associacao-academica-de-coimbra/sporting-clube-de-portugal/1511712/ |title=Académica vs. Sporting CP 0-4 |work=Soccerway |date=24 August 2013 |accessdate=4 September 2014 }} On 19 April 2014, Rojo was sent off in a Primeira Liga match against [[C.F. Os Belenenses]], but Sporting held on for a 1−0 win.{{cite web|url=http://us.soccerway.com/matches/2014/04/19/portugal/portuguese-liga-/clube-futebol--os-belenenses/sporting-clube-de-portugal/1511924/ |title=Belenenses vs. Sporting Club |work=Soccerway |date=19 April 2014 |accessdate=4 September 2014 }} On 13 August 2014, it was announced that Rojo was being disciplined by his club over his refusal to train after handing in a transfer request to force through a move to [[Manchester United]].{{cite web|url=http://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/28763841 |title=Manchester United try to resolve Marcos Rojo stand-off |work=BBC Sport |date=14 August 2014 |accessdate=4 September 2014 }} Sporting president Bruno de Carvalho later alleged that third-party owners of Rojo who were not representatives of Manchester United had pressured his club into selling the player.{{cite news|title=Manchester United: Sporting reveal Marcos Rojo sale 'pressure'|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/29474696|accessdate=4 October 2014|work=BBC Sport|date=3 October 2014}} ===Manchester United=== On 19 August 2014, an agreement to sell Rojo for €20 million (£16 million) was announced by both Sporting and Manchester United.{{cite web|title=Da venda de Marcos Rojo para o Man.Utd, 9M€ irão para a construção do nosso Pavilhão|url=https://twitter.com/Sporting_CP/status/501788409745403904|website=twitter.com|publisher=Sporting CP|accessdate=19 August 2014|language=Portuguese|date=19 August 2014}}{{cite web|title=COMUNICADO|url=http://web3.cmvm.pt/sdi2004/emitentes/docs/FR51803.pdf|website=cmvm.pt|publisher=Portuguese Securities Market Commission|accessdate=19 August 2014|language=Portuguese|date=19 August 2014}}{{cite web|title=#mufc has reached agreement with Sporting Lisbon to sign defender Marcos Rojo, subject to a medical and personal terms.|url=https://twitter.com/ManUtd/status/501800168849948672|website=twitter.com|publisher=Manchester United F.C.|accessdate=19 August 2014|date=19 August 2014}} The next day, United announced that they had signed him on a five-year contract, with [[Nani]] moving to Sporting on a season-long loan. Rojo stated that it was a 'dream' come true to play with Manchester United.{{cite web|title=Manchester United sign Marcos Rojo for £16m on five-year deal |url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/28858116|website=bbc.co.uk/sport|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=20 August 2014| date=20 August 2014}} Rojo missed three matches for United due to difficulties in gaining a [[work permit]], because of pending criminal charges in Argentina, where he is alleged to have had an altercation with a neighbour in 2010.{{cite web|last1=Keegan|first1=Mike|title=Marcos Rojo: Man United signing's debut held up by visa delay|url=http://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/29000089|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=31 August 2014|date=30 August 2014}} On 4 September, he was granted a work permit by the Border Agency to work in England.{{cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.com/manchester-united/story/2019765/marcos-rojo-granted-work-permit-to-play-for-manchester-united |title=Marcos Rojo granted work permit to play for Manchester United |work=ESPNFC |date=4 September 2014 |accessdate=4 September 2014 }} Ten days later he made his debut at [[Old Trafford]] as United won for the first time in the season, playing the entirety of the 4–0 victory over [[Queens Park Rangers F.C.|Queens Park Rangers]].{{cite news |title=Man Utd 4-0 QPR |url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/29098240 |work=BBC Sport |date=14 September 2014 |accessdate=16 September 2014 }} ==International career== [[File:Germany and Argentina face off in the final of the World Cup 2014 -2014-07-13 (27).jpg|thumb|Rojo dribbling past Germany's [[Christoph Kramer]] in the [[2014 FIFA World Cup Final]]]] Rojo was first capped on 9 February 2011 in a 2–1 friendly victory against [[Portugal national football team|Portugal]] at the [[Stade de Suisse]] in [[Geneva]], Switzerland.{{cite news|last1=Edwards|first1=Daniel|title=Argentina 2-1 Portugal: Last-gasp Lionel Messi penalty secures entertaining victory after Cristiano Ronaldo equaliser|url=http://www.goal.com/en-gb/match/argentina-vs-portugal/1053668/report|accessdate=5 September 2014|work=[[Goal.com]]|date=9 February 2011}} Later that year he was included in Argentina's squad as they hosted the [[2011 Copa América]], and played the opening match on 2 July, a 1–1 draw against [[Bolivia national football team|Bolivia]].{{cite news|last1=Gonzalez|first1=Roger|title=Argentina 1-1 Bolivia: Kun Aguero saves Sergio Batista's men in Copa America opener|url=http://www.goal.com/en/match/argentina-vs-bolivia/1049131/report|accessdate=5 September 2014|work=[[Goal.com]]|date=2 July 2011}} [[Javier Zanetti]] replaced him at left back for the rest of the tournament as Argentina reached the quarter-finals. In June 2014, Rojo was named in Argentina's squad for the [[2014 FIFA World Cup]].{{cite news|url=http://www.fifa.com/worldcup/news/y=2014/m=6/news=demichelis-in-argentina-squad-as-trio-miss-out-2353431.html|title=Demichelis in Argentina squad as trio miss out|date=2 June 2014|accessdate=21 June 2014|work=FIFA}} He made his [[FIFA World Cup]] debut in their 2–1 victory over [[Bosnia and Herzegovina national football team|Bosnia and Herzegovina]] at the [[Estádio do Maracanã|Maracanã]], playing the full match in defence.{{cite news|url=http://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/25285099|title=Argentina 2-1 Bos-Herce|date=16 June 2014|accessdate=21 June 2014|work=BBC}} In the team's third group match, Rojo scored his first international goal, the winner in a 3–2 victory against [[Nigeria national football team|Nigeria]].{{cite news|url=http://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/25285406|title=Nigeria 2-3 Argentina|date=25 June 2014|accessdate=26 June 2014|work=BBC}} The country reached the final before losing to [[Germany national football team|Germany]], and Rojo was the only Argentinean named in the [[Castrol Index]] Top 11 for the tournament.{{cite web|url=http://www.fifa.com/worldcup/statistics/castrol-index/top11.html|title=World Cup 2014: Castrol Index Top 11 |publisher=FIFA.com |accessdate=14 July 2014}} ===International goals===
